definition: lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
see 黑沉沉[hei1 chen1 chen1]
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
wild goose
variant of 雁[yan4]

sentences.english: The girl's beauty would put the flowers to shame.
sentences.chinese: 这女子真有沉鱼落雁之容，闭月羞花之貌。

sentences.english: Fish sinking and birds alighting, a description of the stunning beauty of a woman.
sentences.chinese: 后来用“沉鱼落雁”形容女子容貌极美。

definition: lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
divine fragrance, national grace (idiom); an outstanding beauty
a woman of unmatched beauty (idiom)
national grace, divine fragrance (idiom); an outstanding beauty
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
beauty unmatched in her generation (idiom); woman of peerless elegance/prettiest girl ever
looks/appearance
beauty/belle
to have bright eyes and white teeth
natural beauty
the four legendary beauties of ancient China, namely: Xishi 西施[Xi1 shi1], Wang Zhaojun 王昭君[Wang2 Zhao1 jun1], Diaochan 貂蟬|貂蝉[Diao1 Chan2] and Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2]
good-looking and intelligent (idiom)
(of a woman) remarkably beautiful/stunning
